course_title: Clinical Exercise Science for Sports Medicine 1

learning_outcomes.description: demonstrate a sound understanding of sports and exercise science in the field of sports medicine
demonstrate a sound understanding of common practices / roles of nutrition in sports and exercise
demonstrate a sound understanding of ergogenic aids in sports and exercise
demonstrate a sound understanding of basic principles in sports psychology
demonstrate a sound understanding of physical activity (inactivity) / exercise effects / prescription for patients
demonstrate well developed clinical knowledge, reasoning and communication skills for successful completion of case study videos on specific topics in Sports & Exercise Medicine

assessments.task_description:
(Pre-Census) Online Multiple Choice Question Exam to assess learning of materials covered in web video lectures & appropriate textbook chapters for SPMD7005.

Materials from Weeks 1 to 4 (inclusive) will be covered.

The MCQ exams are structured within an overall framework of 2 minutes per question - for example a 50 minute time period would be set for a 25 question MCQ quiz.

Each question has only one (1) correct answer and no marks are deducted for incorrect answers.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Access to the online exam will be through your normal SPMD7005 Blackboard site.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
You will be required to record 2 x Case Video, each 5 to 7 minutes (MAXIMUM) in length, from the topic provided.

A worked example of a demonstration Case Study will be available for your guidance and reference.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You will upload your videos to your private, secure SPMD7005 "My Media" Blackboard Link (instructions will be forwarded during the semester).
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description: Major Online Multiple Choice Question Exam to assess learning of materials covered in web video lectures & appropriate textbook chapters for SPMD7005. The MCQ exams are structured within an overall framework of 2 minutes per question - for example a 30 minute time period would be set for a 15 question MCQ quiz. Each question has only one (1) correct answer and no marks are deducted for incorrect answers.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Access to the online exam will be through your normal SPMD7003 Blackboard site
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description: Reflective Practice Video - Submit a video detailing application of course knowledge for patient care.
assessments.submission_guidelines: To be submitted via the relevant Turnitin submission portal on the course Blackboard site.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

learning_activities.topic:
Video Lectures

Online Video Lectures (Lecture Series): SPMD7005 involves self-directed learning from a comprehensive series of expert online lectures and materials associated readings and textbook chapters (Brukner & Khan). The lectures and associated course materials which are organized in fortnightly "blocks" are progressively sequenced from Weeks 1-2 to Week 13 . The lecture series have been planned and developed by the joint course co-coordinators - Dr Anita Green, Dr Peter Friis and AProf Craig Engstrom. SPMD7005 is based around a core set of lectures from the joint course coordinators and expert contributors such as AProf David Jenkins, Prof Cliff Mallet, etc. SPMD7005 covers a broad spectrum of topics central to sports and exercise medicine.
Readings/Ref: Blackboard URL ; Clinical Sports

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04, L05
